verse.verse_0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
verse.verse_1: Has there come upon man a period of time when he was nothing to be mentioned?
verse.verse_2: We created man from a liquid mixture, to test him; and We made him hearing and seeing.
verse.verse_3: We guided him to the way, be he appreciative or unappreciative.
verse.verse_4: We have prepared for the faithless chains, and yokes, and a Searing Fire.
verse.verse_5: But the righteous will drink from a cup whose mixture is aroma.
verse.verse_6: A spring from which the servants of God will drink, making it gush abundantly.
verse.verse_7: They fulfill their vows, and dread a Day whose ill is widespread.
verse.verse_8: And they feed, for the love of Him, the poor, and the orphan, and the captive.
verse.verse_9: "We only feed you for the sake of God. We want from you neither compensation, nor gratitude.
verse.verse_10: We dread from our Lord a frowning grim Day."
verse.verse_11: So God will protect them from the ills of that Day, and will grant them radiance and joy.
verse.verse_12: And will reward them for their patience with a Garden and silk.
verse.verse_13: Reclining therein on the thrones; experiencing therein neither sun, nor frost.
verse.verse_14: Its shade hovering over them, and its fruit brought low within reach.
verse.verse_15: Passing around them are vessels of silver, and cups of crystal.
verse.verse_16: Crystal of silver-they measured them exactly.
verse.verse_17: They will be served therein with a cup whose flavor is Zanjabeel.
verse.verse_19: Passing among them are eternalized youths. If you see them, you would think them sprinkled pearls.
verse.verse_20: Wherever you look, you see bliss, and a vast kingdom.
verse.verse_21: Upon them are garments of green silk, and satin. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver. And their Lord will offer them a pure drink.
verse.verse_22: "This is a reward for you. Your efforts are well appreciated."
verse.verse_23: It is We who sent down the Quran upon you-a gradual revelation.
verse.verse_24: So be patient for the decision of your Lord, and do not obey the sinner or the blasphemer among them.
verse.verse_25: And mention the Name of your Lord, morning and evening.
verse.verse_26: And for part of the night, prostrate yourself to Him, and glorify Him long into the night.
verse.verse_27: As for these: they love the fleeting life, and leave behind a Heavy Day.
verse.verse_28: We created them, and strengthened their frame; and whenever We will, We can replace them with others like them.
verse.verse_29: This is a reminder; so whoever wills, let him take a path to his Lord.
verse.verse_30: Yet you cannot will, unless God wills. God is Knowing and Wise.
verse.verse_31: He admits into His mercy whomever He wills. But as for the wrongdoers, He has prepared for them a painful punishment.
